faqs.question: Czy obcokrajowcy mogą kupić nieruchomość w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign nationals can purchase property in Spain without citizenship or residence permits. EU citizens face no restrictions whatsoever. Non-EU buyers require NIE (tax identification number) but encounter no purchase limitations. Legal processes are straightforward, requiring Spanish legal representation and tax registration. Ownership rights match Spanish citizen protections, with full rental and sale freedoms.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty zakupu nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically include 6-8% transfer tax (varies by region), legal fees (1-2%), notary costs (0.5%), and administrative fees. For this €279,900 property, estimate approximately €28,000-32,000 in total acquisition costs. These costs are fixed and transparent, with Spanish attorneys itemizing all charges upfront. Mortgage costs, if applicable, add separately to financing expenses.

faqs.question: Czy mogę uzyskać kredyt hipoteczny w Hiszpanii jako obcokrajowiec?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers access Spanish mortgages from major banks (BBVA, Santander, CaixaBank) and international lenders. Typical terms include 70% LTV (loan-to-value), 20-25 year amortization, and interest rates 3.5-4.5% for eligible borrowers. Documentation requirements include proof of income, credit history, and NIE registration. Non-resident status requires additional documentation but does not prevent mortgage access.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty życia na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Monthly living costs in Los Alcazares average €1,200-1,800 for single occupancy (housing, utilities, groceries, local transport). This represents 40-50% lower costs than equivalent UK or Northern European standards. Healthcare, dining, and entertainment costs remain particularly affordable compared to major northern European cities, supporting extended residence affordability.

faqs.question: Czy Costa Blanca jest dobra dla emerytów?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca attracts 400,000+ retirees from Northern Europe due to climate stability, healthcare access, cost affordability, and established communities. Healthcare systems meet international standards, English-language services are widely available, and tax residency offers financial advantages. However, permanent residency requires financial self-sufficiency proof (approximately €27,000 annual income) and healthcare coverage.

faqs.question: What property appreciation trends characterize Los Alcazares?
faqs.answer: Los Alcazares demonstrates 8% year-on-year appreciation, outperforming both Spanish national averages (3-4%) and mature Costa Blanca markets (5-6%).
